Voice Join Address Address The Rotary Club of Toronto TD Canada Trust Tower 161 Bay Street Suites 2631 & 2632 Toronto, Ontario, M5J 2S1 Telephone (416) 363-0604 Fax (416) 363-0686 Email office@rotarytoronto.com Meetings Fridays at 12:00 - 1:30 PM at the National Club, 303 Bay Street, Toronto. Please note that we do not have in person lunches every Friday - kindly contact our office for this week's location. Address Contact Us Enter your email address and the message you want to send. fields are required Name Email Comments I consent to the collection, storage, and use of my information by The Rotary Club of Toronto as described in this Privacy Policy . I understand that I may receive emails, and can opt out at any time. Please confirm you are not a robot. SUBSCRIBE TO OUR WEEKLY NEWSLETTER SUBSCRIBE

Get in Touch — Peconic River Sportsman's Club 0 Skip to Content Home Our History Events All 4H Breast Cancer Fundraiser Ladies Fun Shoot USN Sea Cadets Small Arms Firing School  (SAFS) Civil Air Patrol Fundraising Youth Waterfowl Program LI Skeet Championships Breast Cancer Fundraiser Breast Cancer Survivors Day North Fork Breast Cancer Gala Food Bank Donations BSA & GSA West Point Cadets Veterans Support Police & Fire World Games Shooting Sports Archery Pistol Rifle Black Powder Clay Target Sports National Associations Media Gallery Contact Us Peconic River Sportsman's Club Open Menu Close Menu Open Menu Close Menu Home Our History Events All 4H Breast Cancer Fundraiser Ladies Fun Shoot USN Sea Cadets Small Arms Firing School  (SAFS) Civil Air Patrol Fundraising Youth Waterfowl Program LI Skeet Championships Breast Cancer Fundraiser Breast Cancer Survivors Day North Fork Breast Cancer Gala Food Bank Donations BSA & GSA West Point Cadets Veterans Support Police & Fire World Games Shooting Sports Archery Pistol Rifle Black Powder Clay Target Sports National Associations Media Gallery Contact Us Peconic River Sportsman's Club Home Our History Folder: Events Back All 4H Breast Cancer Fundraiser Ladies Fun Shoot USN Sea Cadets Small Arms Firing School  (SAFS) Civil Air Patrol Fundraising Youth Waterfowl Program LI Skeet Championships Breast Cancer Fundraiser Breast Cancer Survivors Day North Fork Breast Cancer Gala Food Bank Donations BSA & GSA West Point Cadets Veterans Support Police & Fire World Games Folder: Shooting Sports Back Archery Pistol Rifle Black Powder Clay Target Sports National Associations Media Gallery Contact Us We would love to hear from you. Although Peconic River Sportsman’s Club is a private 501c7 entity, there are many opportunities for the public to register to utilize our skeet, clay, and archery shooting ranges plus participate in skilled rifle and pistol competitions. (Including competitions with national sporting organizations.) We also host many charity outings and have raised in excess of $362,000 over the years. Please don’t hesitate to reach out for more information. admin@peconicriversportsmansclub.com Peconic River Sportsman's Club South Side Entrance: Shotgun Venues 1 Connecticut Avenue Manorville, NY 11949 Main Entrance: 389 River Road Manorville, NY 11949 Contact: 631.727.5248 admin@peconicriversportsmansclub.com

About Us - Rotary Club of Nashville About Us Membership Service NRST People of Action News Rotaract of Nashville Rotary Resources Member Login Join Rotary Contact Us Sign-Up Genius Facebook Twitter Instagram Search Member Login Join Rotary Contact Us Sign-Up Genius Facebook Twitter Instagram Search Give About Us Membership Service NRST People of Action Rotaract of Nashville Latest News Resources Rotary Club of Nashville About Us Our Mission To impact our community by providing forums for fellowship, understanding and service among engaged leaders. People of Action We are proud to be a part of Rotary International. Over 1.2 million members worldwide share a common passion for Service Above Self. At weekly meetings, members catch up with friends, hear what’s happening in our communities, and share plans and exchange ideas for creating lasting change. A connection with Rotary gives members the chance to develop skills like public speaking, project management, and event planning. Rotarians meet interesting people from the community and around the world. We tackle local and international issues that are important to our fellow club members. We provide service opportunities, social events, and work together to make Nashville a stronger community. Since it’s founding, the Rotary Club of Nashville has hosted prominent speakers and engaging weekly programs. We are honored the Governor, the Mayor, and other leaders choose our venue to present their views on current issues. History The Rotary Club of Nashville was organized on November 19, 1913, when thirteen businessmen gathered at the office of James A. Cayce, President of B. H. Steif Jewelry Company. Charter Number 94 was granted to the Club on February 1, 1914. Today, more than 35,000 clubs comprise Rotary International with over 1,200,000 members in 200 geographical regions of the world. The Rotary Club of Nashville has proudly furnished one Rotary International President, Will R. Manier, and ten District Governors. Nashville Rotary Service Trust Since 1914, members of the Rotary Club of Nashville have shared a proud tradition of providing organized community service for those in need. Through the Nashville Rotary Service Trust, our members provide financial support and volunteer service to ensure the continued success of our humanitarian efforts. This member commitment is what makes Rotary unique.
